intro: Hypochaeris sonchoides, commonly known as the common sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its upright stems and basal rosette of leaves, which are usually hairy and spoon-shaped. The plant produces yellow flowers with ray florets that bloom in the summer months. It is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is considered a weed in agricultural settings. Hypochaeris sonchoides has a taproot system and is capable of rapid growth, making it a resilient species in various environments.
